comments.html: Yes, the core transport would work properly (or at least IPv4 and IPv6 would break at the same time ;)... unless of course you're running IPv4 natively and IPv6 over MPLS, in which case you already treat them differently.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
Kind of....a dumb question.

When one has dual stack at the edge, and 6PE in the core, wouldn't that essentially help keep the stacks working properly as long as one can still have labeled routes resolving and pushing traffic?
comments.name: Anonymous
